Anders South

Here‚Äôs a comprehensive analysis of Anders South in Red Deer, Alberta:

‚úÖ 1. Nearby Amenities & Attractions

  • Parks & Trails: Close to Westerner Park, walking paths and green spaces in the Anders South and Aspen Ridge zone.
  • Shopping & Services: Within short driving distance of big‚Äëbox retail, restaurants, grocery stores and Jugo Juice, Galaxy Cinemas at Westerner Park area (Calgary RE/MAX Directory, Andrew Russell & Associates).
  • Community Life: Community association actively runs events and collaborates with schools and police to support neighbourhood watch and safety programs (Chris Strong Realtor).

üè° 2. Housing Age & Styles

  • Homes were primarily built in the late 1990s to early‚Äë2000s, with some infill newer custom builds such as two‚Äëstorey executive homes (e.g., stucco & stone facades, large lots with shops) (Drumheller Real Estate).
  • Common types: Mostly single‚Äëdetached homes (~52% of dwellings in Anders South/Aspen Ridge), followed by apartments (~12%), townhouses (~0.4%) and duplex/semi‚Äëdetached (~3.5%) (City of Red Deer).

üìä 3. Zoning & Density

  • Zoning is primarily R‚Äë1 single‚Äëfamily residential. Most lots are single‚Äëfamily units; secondary suites may be allowed under city accessory suite policies. Multi‚Äëunit redevelopment is limited unless lots are subdivided or rezoned ‚Äî there‚Äôs no widespread allowance for duplex or triplex on standard lots without rezoning. (City zoning maps exist through the Red Deer GIS portal) (City of Red Deer).

üë• 4. Population & Growth

  • In 2019, population for the Anders South/Aspen Ridge zone was 3,867, very stable compared to 2016/2015 (~3,884/3,887). Zone growth in that period was essentially flat (slight decline) while the city overall grew ~1.2% from 2016 to 2019 (City of Red Deer).
  • Expect modest growth since, consistent with infill rather than expansion.

üí∞ 5. Income & Demographics

  • Anders South median household income around CAD‚ÄØ168,090, which is ~7% higher cost‚Äëof‚Äëliving but aligned with livability better than other Red Deer areas. Median age is about 24% higher than city average, indicating older/more established households (Andrew Russell & Associates).

üö® 6. Crime Rate & Safety

  • Among the safest neighbourhoods in Red Deer. Crime rates are about 60% lower than the city average. It‚Äôs widely noted for active neighbourhood watch, high civic engagement and very low violent and property crime (Andrew Russell & Associates).
  • Contrast to general warnings about Red Deer overall from anecdotal reports ‚Äî Anders South remains an outlier in safety (Reddit).

üèòÔ∏è 7. Rental Market (Supply / Demand, Rents)

  • Rental supply is modest ‚Äî primarily in secondary suites or boarder situations; formal multi‚Äëunit product limited. Demand is steady from young professionals or families attracted to safety and schools.
  • Average rents in Red Deer roughly A‚Äëframe (two‚Äëbedroom apartments) range CAD‚ÄØ1,200‚Äì1,400; for single‚Äëfamily home lease around CAD‚ÄØ1,800‚Äì2,200 per month depending on size and finish.

üèÖ 8. Neighbourhood Grade

Based on income, safety, amenities, housing quality and demographics, Anders South qualifies as an ‚ÄúA‚Äëgrade‚Äù neighbourhood ‚Äî one of the most desirable areas in Red Deer (Drumheller Real Estate, Andrew Russell & Associates).

üìà 9. Average Home Prices

  • City-wide Red Deer average listing price (August‚ÄØ4,‚ÄØ2025) ~ CAD‚ÄØ466,740 (Shantel Campbell).
  • Anders South listings show upper‚Äëmid range: e.g., ~$638,800 to over $1‚ÄØmillion for larger executive homes; average in Anders Park ~ CAD‚ÄØ500,920 (similar character) (Real Estate Homes).

üîÆ 10. Appreciation vs Cash Flow

  • Long‚Äëterm potential: modest home price growth in Red Deer market (around +7% YoY, slowing to <1% monthly) (Big John).
  • High upfront investment in Anders South means capital appreciation strapped to city growth.
  • Cash‚Äëflow outlook is moderate: rental yields lower in single‚Äëfamily in mature zone; however low vacancy and stable demand lend to consistent cash flow. Total returns hinge more on price appreciation than rental yield.

üß† 11. Investment Strategies That May Work

  1. Buy & Hold Single‚ÄëFamily for Cash Flow: Secondary suite or legal accessory suite improves yield.
  2. Renovation Flip: Mid‚Äëprice home rehab for resale to premium‚Äëincome households.
  3. Infill/Re‚Äësubdivision: On large lots, apply for subdivision or duplex zoning if permitted.
  4. Niche Rental: Lease high‚Äëend executive family homes to professionals ‚Äì premium rent segment.
  5. Long‚Äëterm Value Appreciation: Hold in stable neighbourhood expecting steady price growth even if slower than major metro.

üöÄ Final Take

Anders South is a premium, family‚Äëoriented neighbourhood with high incomes, low crime, spacious homes and solid livability. While rental yield may be moderate, the area‚Äôs safety and affluence support strong appreciation potential and demand for executive rentals or renovation resale. Zoning restricts multi-unit builds unless rezoned, so strategies focus on single-family asset plays, accessory suites, or high-end flips.
